verses.roman:
dhunvanta uttarāsaṅgān
patiṁ vīkṣya cirāgatam
uttarāḥ kosalā mālyaiḥ
kiranto nanṛtur mudā

synonyms: dhunvantaḥ—waving; uttara-āsaṅgān—the upper cloths covering the body; patim—the Lord; vīkṣya—seeing; cira-āgatam—returned after many years of banishment; uttarāḥ kosalāḥ—the citizens of Ayodhyā; mālyaiḥ kirantaḥ—offering Him garlands; nanṛtuḥ—began to dance; mudā—in great jubilation.
translation: The citizens of Ayodhyā, upon seeing their King return after a long absence, offered Him flower garlands, waved their upper cloths, and danced in great jubilation.
